name: 1.Project Overview
content:
Banking Dataset â€“ Deposit Opening Classification Problem

Objective

Banks often run marketing campaigns to encourage customers to open term deposits. The challenge is that not all customers respond, and campaigns can be costly.

The goal here is to predict which customers are most likely to subscribe to a term deposit based on data from past campaigns. This helps the bank focus efforts on the right customers and improve overall campaign success.

Approach

  1. Data Exploration & Preparation: Analyze the marketing campaign dataset to clean, organize, and understand key customer patterns.
  2. Model Selection: Use the Random Forest classification model to handle complex customer behavior and improve prediction accuracy.
  3. Model Development: Train the model to predict the likelihood of a customer opening a term deposit.
  4. Evaluation & Refinement: Test the model, refine it for accuracy, and ensure it performs well across different customer segments.

Significance

  • Better Campaign Success: By targeting the right customers, the bank increases the chances of more deposits being opened.
  • Efficient Resource Use: Marketing time and budget are used more effectively, reducing wasted efforts on low-probability customers.

Expected Outcomes

  • Accurate Predictions: A reliable model that identifies customers likely to subscribe to a term deposit.
  • Smarter Campaign Planning: Data-driven insights that guide marketing strategy for higher conversion rates.
  • Optimized Marketing: More focused campaigns that balance cost and effectiveness.
